page.title: 10CLIMATE of Blindcrake
page.content: The average height of the area is about 500 feet AMSL. To the north is the Solway and Scotland, West the sea and south and East the hills of Lakeland. The prevailing winds from the SW are often wet. Wind from the north is cold and usually dry but bringing snow in Winter. High winds affect vegetation growth. There is about 40 inches of rain each year with a higher proportion of wet to dry days. A good growth of lichen indicates clean air but there may be some pollution (from farms?) as watercress no longer grows in the streams. Geiger counter checks registered zero after the recent problems at Winscale.
